title: Occasional 'Stuck key' in CS2
body:
Occasionally, when using Snapkey in CS2, a key will 'stick' and stay depressed when it is physically not being pressed in that instance of time. 

Here's what I know. 
-From my experience, it appears that a key may stick when using the inputs (SHFT+A), and in one instance where it was (SHFT+A,S). Occurs when I walk backward in CS. 
-Unsticking the key is done by releasing all keys and selecting the opposite key, and snapkey is back to normal. 

I will attempt to replicate it and report back.
author: NCOOP03

comments.body: I can confirm that I face following behaviour a lot through out game sessions (cs2) and my "Crouch" bind to the SHIFT

> I can confirm that I face following behaviour a lot through out game sessions (cs2) and my "Crouch" bind to the SHIFT

Hey @dpyrozhok, they already fixed it in the latest version. Just download the newest release :)

> not working with valorant

few more details would be preferred and helpful, aka
- snapkey version
- snapkey config
- key combinations that cause the issue
- any way to replicate the issue

and if you can consistently replicate the issue, perhaps create a new issue post related

The issue was resolved with the 1.2.1v release. I was using the 1.2.0v I had downloaded the day before. 

Everything works fine. I tested it on Apex as well.

title: can it get me banned
body: im sure it wouldnt get me banned on CS but im not too sure about valorant as it can be considered as cheating, did you try it on something other than CS
author: Ayush-Mann-0

comments.body: I tried it on Valorant for a while (2 competitive matches) and nothing happened so I guess it's fine.
